Class DeadManSwitch

  • java.lang.Object
    • DeadManSwitch

  • public class DeadManSwitch
extends java.lang.Object
    The dead man switch class. It is the interface between the hardware and the software
    It should only be interacted with through the set and stop methods.
    It runs the given runnables on the timer thread.
    Author:
    mhrumman

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte STATE_BUTTON_PRESSED 
      static byte STATE_NEITHER 
      static byte STATE_TIMED_OUT

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static DeadManSwitch get()
        Gets the global instance of the dead man switch

      • set

        public void set(long timeOut,
       java.lang.Runnable buttonPressed,
       java.lang.Runnable timedOut)
        Sets the timer thread and activates it.
        If a timer is already set, it stops it and overrides it. The timer runs on a seperate thread, so this does not halt execution, and merely starts it.
        Parameters:
        timeOut - The timeout, in milliseconds
        buttonPressed - The function to run when the button is pressed
        timedOut - The function to run when the thread times out without the button being pressed

      • stop

        public void stop(byte state)
        Stops the command based with the reason based of the given state. If the state is STATE_BUTTON_PRESSED or STATE_TIMED_OUT, it will activate the corresponding action. Pass STATE_NEITHER for neither to be activated If the timer is not running, it does nothing
        Parameters:
        state -

      • getEndTime

        public long getEndTime()
        Gets the end time for the current timer, if timer is not set it returns -1
        Returns:
        End time for timer of -1

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Gets whether or not the timer thread is running
